<li id="cite_note-mount_vernon_house_of_burgesses_start-4"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-mount_vernon_house_of_burgesses_start_4-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.mountvernon.org/library/digitalhistory/digital-encyclopedia/article/House-of-Burgesses" rel="nofollow">"House of Burgesses"</a>. <i>The Digital Encyclopedia of George Washington</i>. Mount Vernon Ladies' Association<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">May 9,</span> 2020</span>. <q>After a failed bid for a seat in December 1755, he won election in 1758 and represented Frederick County until 1765.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=The+Digital+Encyclopedia+of+George+Washington&amp;rft.atitle=House+of+Burgesses&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.mountvernon.org%2Flibrary%2Fdigitalhistory%2Fdigital-encyclopedia%2Farticle%2FHouse-of-Burgesses&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AGeorge+Washington"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-5"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-5">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://founders.archives.gov/documents/Washington/02-05-02-0273-0006" rel="nofollow">"Enclosure V: Frederick County Poll Sheet, 1758, 24 July 1758"</a>. National Historical Publications and Records Commission (The U.S. National Archives and Records Administration). 1758<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">May 8,</span> 2020</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Enclosure+V%3A+Frederick+County+Poll+Sheet%2C+1758%2C+24+July+1758&amp;rft.pub=National+Historical+Publications+and+Records+Commission+%28The+U.S.+National+Archives+and+Records+Administration%29&amp;rft.date=1758&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Ffounders.archives.gov%2Fdocuments%2FWashington%2F02-05-02-0273-0006&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AGeorge+Washington"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-mount_vernon_house_of_burgesses_end-6"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-mount_vernon_house_of_burgesses_end_6-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-mount_vernon_house_of_burgesses_end_6-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.mountvernon.org/library/digitalhistory/digital-encyclopedia/article/House-of-Burgesses" rel="nofollow">"House of Burgesses"</a>. <i>The Digital Encyclopedia of George Washington</i>. Mount Vernon Ladies' Association<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">May 9,</span> 2020</span>. <q>That year he ran in Fairfax County, winning a seat which he would retain until 1775 ... Dunmore did not call the House again until June of 1775. The House adjourned on June 24 and never again achieved a quorum (enough members to conduct business).</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=The+Digital+Encyclopedia+of+George+Washington&amp;rft.atitle=House+of+Burgesses&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.mountvernon.org%2Flibrary%2Fdigitalhistory%2Fdigital-encyclopedia%2Farticle%2FHouse-of-Burgesses&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AGeorge+Washington"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-7"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-7">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFBish2010">Bish, Jim (Spring 2010). <a class="external text" href="https://alexandriahistorical.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/05/2010_Sp_Chronicle.pdf" rel="nofollow">"Hugh West and the West Family's Momentous Role in Founding and Developing Alexandria and Fairfax and Loudoun Counties, Virginia"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <i>The Alexandria Chronicle</i>. Alexandria Historical Society. pp. 13–14<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">May 10,</span> 2020</span>. <q>In 1755 Hugh West Jr. gave up his seat in Fairfax County and won a House of Burgess election in Frederick County defeating Colonel George Washington. This defeat was Washington's only electoral loss. Hugh West Jr. served as a Frederick County burgess until 1758 when he was defeated by Washington.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+Alexandria+Chronicle&amp;rft.atitle=Hugh+West+and+the+West+Family%27s+Momentous+Role+in+Founding+and+Developing+Alexandria+and+Fairfax+and+Loudoun+Counties%2C+Virginia&amp;rft.ssn=spring&amp;rft.pages=13-14&amp;rft.date=2010&amp;rft.aulast=Bish&amp;rft.aufirst=Jim&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Falexandriahistorical.org%2Fwp-content%2Fuploads%2F2018%2F05%2F2010_Sp_Chronicle.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AGeorge+Washington"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-8"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-8">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://founders.archives.gov/documents/Washington/02-02-02-0229" rel="nofollow">"To George Washington from Adam Stephen, 23 December 1755"</a>. National Historical Publications and Records Commission (The U.S. National Archives and Records Administration). 1755<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">May 10,</span> 2020</span>. <q>GW kept a copy of the Frederick County poll sheet (c. 10 Dec., DLC:GW) in his papers with the names of the 40 men who voted for him and the names of the 271 men who voted for Hugh West and 270 who voted for Thomas Swearingen.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=To+George+Washington+from+Adam+Stephen%2C+23+December+1755&amp;rft.pub=National+Historical+Publications+and+Records+Commission+%28The+U.S.+National+Archives+and+Records+Administration%29&amp;rft.date=1755&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Ffounders.archives.gov%2Fdocuments%2FWashington%2F02-02-02-0229&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AGeorge+Washington"></span></span>
</li>

</li>

<li id="cite_note-37"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-37">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFCongdonDeardorff1967">Congdon, Charles Edwin; Deardorff, M.H. Alfred A. Knopf. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0679404934" title="Special:BookSources/978-0679404934"><bdi>978-0679404934</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Radicalism+of+the+American+Revolution&amp;rft.pub=Alfred+A.+Knopf&amp;rft.date=1992&amp;rft.isbn=978-0679404934&amp;rft.aulast=Wood&amp;rft.aufirst=Gordon+S.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3D6lGinKwz7l8C%26q%3Dpatriot&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AGeorge+Washington"></span></li>

Retrieved <span class="nowrap">June 11,</span> 2019</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=CW+Journal&amp;rft.atitle=How+Did+Washington+Make+His+Millions%3F&amp;rft.ssn=winter&amp;rft.date=2013&amp;rft.aulast=Gardner&amp;rft.aufirst=Andrew+G.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.history.org%2Ffoundation%2Fjournal%2Fwinter13%2Fwashington.cfm&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AGeorge+Washington"></span></li>
<li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="Ancestry">Hardy, Ph.D., Rob. <a class="external text" href="https://www.mountvernon.org/library/digitalhistory/digital-encyclopedia/article/ancestry/" rel="nofollow">"Ancestry"</a>. <i>mountvernon.org</i>. Carleton College.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=mountvernon.org&amp;rft.atitle=Ancestry&amp;rft.aulast=Hardy%2C+Ph.D.&amp;rft.aufirst=Rob&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.mountvernon.org%2Flibrary%2Fdigitalhistory%2Fdigital-encyclopedia%2Farticle%2Fancestry%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AGeorge+Washington"></span></li>
<li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="Urwin_(October_19,_2021)">Urwin, Gregory J. W. <ul><li><a href="/wiki/Martha_Washington" title="Martha Washington">Martha Washington</a> (wife)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/John_Parke_Custis" title="John Parke Custis">John Parke Custis</a> (stepson)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/George_Washington_Parke_Custis" title="George Washington Parke Custis">George Washington Parke Custis</a> (step-grandson, adopted son)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Eleanor_Parke_Custis_Lewis" title="Eleanor Parke Custis Lewis">Eleanor Parke Custis</a> (step-granddaughter, adopted daughter)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Augustine_Washington" title="Augustine Washington">Augustine Washington</a> (father)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Mary_Ball_Washington" title="Mary Ball Washington">Mary Ball Washington</a> (mother)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Lawrence_Washington_(1718%E2%80%931752)" title="Lawrence Washington (1718–1752)">Lawrence Washington</a> (half-brother)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Augustine_Washington_Jr." title="Augustine Washington Jr.">Augustine Washington Jr.</a> (half-brother)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Betty_Washington_Lewis" title="Betty Washington Lewis">Betty Washington Lewis</a> (sister)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Samuel_Washington" title="Samuel Washington">Samuel Washington</a> (brother)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/John_Augustine_Washington" title="John Augustine Washington">John A. Washington</a> (brother)</li>

<th colspan="3" style="border-top: 5px solid #CF9C65;">Military offices
</th></tr>
<tr>
<td style="width: 30%; text-align: center;"><b>Office established </b>
</td>
<td rowspan="1" style="width: 40%; text-align: center;"><b> Commander in Chief of the <a href="/wiki/Continental_Army" title="Continental Army">Continental Army</a> </b><br/>1775–1783
</td>
<td rowspan="1" style="width: 30%; text-align: center;">Succeeded by<div style="font-weight: bold"><a href="/wiki/Henry_Knox" title="Henry Knox">Henry Knox</a></div><small><i><b>as <a href="/wiki/Commanding_General_of_the_United_States_Army" title="Commanding General of the United States Army">Senior Officer</a></b></i></small>
</td></tr>
<tr style="text-align:center;">
<td rowspan="1" style="width:30%;">Preceded by<div style="font-weight: bold"><a href="/wiki/James_Wilkinson" title="James Wilkinson">James Wilkinson</a></div>
</td>
<td rowspan="1" style="width: 40%; text-align: center;"><b> <a href="/wiki/Commanding_General_of_the_United_States_Army" title="Commanding General of the United States Army">Senior Officer of the United States Army</a> </b><br/>1798–1799
</td>
<td rowspan="1" style="width: 30%; text-align: center;">Succeeded by<div style="font-weight: bold"><a href="/wiki/Alexander_Hamilton" title="Alexander Hamilton">Alexander Hamilton</a></div>
</td></tr>

<li><a href="/wiki/Timeline_of_the_Joe_Biden_presidency" title="Timeline of the Joe Biden presidency">Biden</a></li></ul>
</div></td></tr><tr><td class="navbox-abovebelow hlist" colspan="2"><div>
<ul><li><b><img alt="" class="noviewer" data-file-height="185" data-file-width="180" decoding="async" height="16" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/96/Symbol_category_class.svg/16px-Symbol_category_class.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/96/Symbol_category_class.svg/23px-Symbol_category_class.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/96/Symbol_category_class.svg/31px-Symbol_category_class.svg.png 2x" title="Category" width="16"/> <a href="/wiki/Category:Presidents_of_the_United_States" title="Category:Presidents of the United States">Category</a></b></li>

class="navbox-title" colspan="3" scope="col" style="background-color:#003399;color:#FFFFFF;"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:Washington_and_Lee_University" title="Template:Washington and Lee University"><abbr <ul><li>The College</li>
<li>Williams School of Commerce, Economics, and Politics</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Washington_and_Lee_University_School_of_Law" title="Washington and Lee University School of Law">School of Law</a></li></ul>
